news.title: Gurugram: ED attaches ₹82 crore worth of properties in fraud related to 'Ansal Hub-83' project
news.para: The project is spread over a land area of 19 Kanal 15 Marla (approximately 2.47 acres) and consists of 147 commercial shops, 137 office spaces and two restaurant units, ED said on Thursday.

news.title: Rajasthan HC gives housing board three weeks to clear illegal Sanganer colonies
news.para: Rajasthan High Court has given the Rajasthan Housing Board three weeks to remove 87 illegal colonies in Sanganer. The court warned the housing board commissioner must appear if the order is not followed. This follows a petition highlighting the state government's attempt to regularize colonies on land acquired by the housing board.

news.title: HMT land bank may be monetised as AI clusters
news.para: India is preparing a plan to use land owned by HMT Ltd for artificial intelligence clusters. HMT has a large land bank across several states. Investment plans of around ₹10,000 crore are being drawn up for these AI clusters. The government is considering a report on HMT's revival. This initiative aims to clear worker and statutory dues.

news.title: Take action to fix tech issues in offices: CREDAI to Karnataka government
news.para: CREDAI has urged the state government to address technical problems plaguing government offices. These issues are hindering the issuance of e-khatas, causing delays for developers and property owners. CREDAI also called for the removal of the life certificate requirement for GPA registrations. This rule has become a burden for senior citizens and non-residents.

news.title: Pune civic body's GB rejects property tax hike proposal, PCMC likely to maintain status quo
news.para: Pune civic body's general body unanimously dismissed a 5% property tax hike proposal, urging the administration to improve tax recovery and widen the tax net instead. Pimpri Chinchwad residents are also likely to be spared an increase due to the absence of a standing committee, delaying the proposal's submission.

news.title: Land acquisition completed for Google data centre project in Visakhapatnam
news.para: Visakhapatnam district administration has acquired 308 acres in Tarluwada for Google's proposed data centre, a key component of a $15 billion AI hub investment. The project, involving partners like Adani Infra and Bharti Airtel subsidiaries, aims to transform Visakhapatnam into a technology hub, with land acquisition now complete after offering substantial compensation and benefits to assignees.

news.title: Ranchi smart city project gains momentum with land mutation almost resolved
news.para: Ranchi's decade-old Smart City project is finally accelerating as the crucial land mutation issue nears resolution. With over 450 acres mutated and plots allocated, infrastructure is in place.  The ambitious project, aiming for 15,000 homes and advanced amenities, is now poised for significant development, with plans for future phases underway.

news.title: US-based ICE Mortgage Tech leases nearly two lakh sq ft in Pune to set up GCC
news.para: Intercontinental Exchange is expanding its presence in India. Its subsidiary, ICE Mortgage Technology India, has leased a significant office space in Pune's Magarpatta Cybercity. This move aims to establish a global capability centre. The company will utilise the space for product engineering and technology operations.

news.title: Nepotism, self-aggrandizement anathema to democratic system: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has cancelled flat allotments made by a Haryana government housing society. The court found the allotments to a governing body member and his subordinate to be arbitrary and biased. Nepotism and self-aggrandizement were cited as reasons for the cancellation. The court also imposed costs on the housing society and the individuals involved.

news.title: Hyderabad's Bharathi Builders India accused of duping investors with pre-launch offer
news.para: Cyberabad EOW sleuths registered a cheating case against Bharathi Builders India and its management. A private worker alleged that the firm duped him and 300 other investors of crores through a pre-launch offer for a project in Bhanur. Buyers invested in Bharathi Green Empire Heights, promised completion within 30 months.

news.title: Permits for housing construction rebound in 2025, German statistics office says
news.para: In 2025, Germany experienced a rejuvenating boost in housing construction permits, breaking a three-year slump. This upturn is being hailed by experts as a promising sign for the construction sector's recovery. To maintain this momentum, the government is implementing strategic policy reforms. Nevertheless, the country continues to grapple with a considerable housing crisis.

news.title: Single-family housing starts rebound in January, building permits decline in USA
news.para: American home construction saw a rebound in December. However, fewer permits for new homes suggest underlying issues. Higher mortgage rates and material costs are impacting the sector. Builders face rising land and construction expenses. This situation is affecting housing affordability across the nation. Experts believe more supply is needed to address these challenges.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh assembly approves bill reducing vacant land tax to 50% during construction
news.para: The House passed an amendment allowing only 50 per cent of the vacant land tax to be paid during the building construction period. It also approved a bill to remove the term "leprosy" from municipal laws.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Vastrapur societies to give land for road widening, to get taller buildings
news.para: Societies in Vastrapur village are voluntarily relinquishing land for road widening, enabling expedited redevelopment with taller buildings. This initiative addresses stalled projects due to narrow road widths, which previously limited construction heights under development regulations. The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation will widen roads to 12 meters, resolving traffic congestion and facilitating society redevelopment.

news.title: Ludhiana Improvement Trust evaluates properties worth crores ahead of key court ruling
news.para: Ludhiana Improvement Trust is evaluating prime real estate, including the stalled City Centre project, in anticipation of potential legal outcomes. This move aims to generate funds for city development through upcoming auctions, with the City Centre structure valued at approximately ₹1,700 crore. LIT awaits a court decision on the ongoing civil dispute.

news.title: Two-thirds of Gurugram's houses not linked to authorised sewer lines
news.para: Gurugram and Faridabad face a severe sanitation crisis, with a majority of households lacking legal sewer connections. While Gurugram has 66.6% of homes outside the formal system, Faridabad's figure is even higher at 79.1%. Authorities are working to streamline the application process and address infrastructure deficits to tackle this growing problem.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Illegal PG in LIG housing scheme in Science City area sealed
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's vigilance team sealed an illegal paying guest facility operating within the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana's Everest Enclave scheme.  A surprise raid revealed one house actively used as a PG and another listed on Airbnb, prompting further inquiry into 35 suspiciously vacant properties.

news.title: Muthoot Microfin looks to buy company offering loan against property
news.para: Muthoot Microfin is exploring inorganic growth by acquiring a majority stake in two non-banking financial companies. This move aims to expand its micro loan against property business. The company is diversifying its portfolio following recent RBI policy changes. Muthoot Microfin plans to significantly increase its secured lending. This strategy will reduce reliance on unsecured microfinance loans.
